stories.title: BBC Ending support for RSS Podcasts

stories.text:
I am new to the world of VR/XR. I collected some headsets ( HTC Vice, Oculus quest ) and ordered some more ( Magic Leap and an HTC VIVE Pro Eye ).

I want to create VR/AR experiences to test functionality like eye tracking and similar. But I am a little bit confused about which API to use. I want these experiences to be in a website and access some device functionality like the eye-tracking capability.

Which API and framework should I use? - The WebXR API with thrre.js of Babylon? - Unity ( OpenXR ) and build for web? Or export to WebXR with the Mozilla plugin?
stories.title: Ask HN: Which tech should I use for creating XR Prototypes?

stories.text:
Since I can not view anything anymore without being logged in, Twitter is entirely useless to me, but it does not let me unsubscribe.

I wonder if that is legal at all.
stories.title: Tell HN: Twitter email unsubscribe throws 403
